question: As shown in <image 1>, the fact that your cell phone is using outdated technology within a year or two of purchase is an example of ____________.
description: The image displays a collection of older model cell phones, each with distinct designs and features indicative of past technological trends. Among these devices, there are several classic candy-bar style phones with physical keypads, some featuring QWERTY keyboards, while others have traditional numeric keypads. The screens on these phones appear small compared to modern standards, and their overall design suggests they were manufactured during an earlier era of mobile technology. The phones exhibit signs of wear and tear, such as scratches and discoloration, indicating prolonged use over time. The variety of models and their dated appearance suggest that these devices have been rendered obsolete by newer, more advanced smartphones. This rapid obsolescence highlights a common practice in the tech industry where products are designed to become outdated quickly, compelling consumers to upgrade frequently. This phenomenon is known as planned obsolescence.
